channel.title: NAIF News
channel.description: NAIF news posts: updates, progress reports, findings, and opinion pieces on interoperability and findable research results.

item.title: NAIF at the Research on Research Event 2026
item.dc:creator: Dr Moritz Mähr
item.description: From 29 to 30 January 2026, the Center for Reproducible Science and Research Synthesis (CRS) at the University of Zurich hosted the Research on Research (RoR) Event 2026. NAIF Track 1 contributed a poster on the responsible use of quantitative scientometric indicators (QSI) in Swiss Higher Education Institutions (HEI).

item.title: Prioritising Actions for Better Academic Metadata
item.dc:creator: Dr Moritz Mähr
item.description: NAIF Track 4 held its second workshop to classify and prioritise 16 proposed actions for improving academic metadata in Swiss repositories using the Agreement & Certainty Matrix.

item.title: What Switzerland Can Learn from Other Countries: Review of the event “From Policy to Practice: Building a National Open Research Information Framework in Switzerland”
item.dc:creator: Dr Melanie Röthlisberger
item.description: Review of the NAIF event “From Policy to Practice” with inputs from Denmark, the Netherlands, and Finland.

item.title: Responsible Use of Quantitative Scientometric Indicators: Insights from the 6th SYoS Workshop
item.dc:creator: Dr Martin Jaekel
item.description: Insights from the 6th Swiss Year of Scientometrics workshop on responsible use of quantitative scientometric indicators in research assessment.

item.title: Enhancing Open Academic Data through NAIF Track 4
item.dc:creator: Dr Moritz Mähr
item.description: NAIF presented its Track 4 work on enhancing academic metadata at the first Swiss Open Academic Data Day at ETH Zurich.

item.title: Launching NAIF: A Look Back at the Information Event
item.dc:creator: Dr David Johann
Simon Willemin
item.description: The NAIF project held its first public information event on 28 August 2025, introducing its goals for Swiss research findability.

item.title: Project start
item.dc:creator: Dr David Johann
Simon Willemin
item.description: We are pleased to announce the launch of the NAIF project. NAIF is also listed among the approved projects in the swissuniversities Programme Open Science II call “Supporting Green Open Access” (decision: 23 June 2025).
